intro: Impatiens chishuiensis, commonly known as the Chishui Impatiens, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist forest environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often trailing. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
